item.title: The 12 objects that defined 2025, for better or for worse

item.title: This Sentence Structure Is a Dead Giveaway That AI Wrote It
item.description: Forget lists of words and punctuation marks. If you really want to know if a text was written by AI, look for this particular sentence structure.

item.title: The new American Dream has parents easing up on college expectations for their kids—1 in 3 are now open to trade school instead
item.description: “Parents are waking up,” career strategist says. “College doesn’t carry the same [return on investment] it once did.”

item.description: David Ko said most executives will say they’re good when you ask how they are. Some additional interrogation suggests the opposite is true.

item.title: The Year-End Ritual That Cuts Stress and Kick-Starts Your Best January Yet
item.description: How one intentional week of closing loops can boost energy, sharpen focus, and break the cycle of year-end burnout.

item.title: Meta’s 28-year-old billionaire prodigy says the next Bill Gates will be a 13-year-old who is ‘vibe coding’ right now

item.title: Want to Be Truly Helpful? Harvard Research Says Stop Giving People Advice, and Start Doing This
item.description: Don’t offer your opinion. Instead, think of questions the other person needs to answer–for themselves.
